raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!

System: C++. :)
User: Why C++?
System: I just like it. :)
User: How about between Java and Python?
System: I haven't started learning Python yet.
User: I think Java is the best

User: I hate Python

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: doing okay, feeling a little bit under the weather
System: Aw, I hope you feel better soon!
User: thanks! the weather is getting worse

User: no, it won't get better any time soon. we have to wait until spring

User: yea, I'm really feeling under the weather
System: Aw, well that's no good.

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi
User: Okay...so I need someone to help me though a scenario I've been pondering.
System: Sure, whats the scenario?
User: My partner's former friend invited me for lunch (they are not in good books right now). But during their friendship I formed an independent bond with the other person because we all used to hang out a lot. Now I feel like I have to take sides.
System: That's a tough scenario to be in :) I firmly believe in talking this through with your partner. Though i don't know the specifics of why things went bad between your partner and his friend, but I believe things can always improve between friends.
User: I hope they do. Getting older already means smaller circles. It sucks to lose friends for arbitrary reasons. That's good advice though. I fear raising the issue might sound like treason. Lol.
System: True about that! I also think time helps to heal certain situations. So may be doing nothing is the best way forward.
User: AKA avoiding all texts from everyone?
System: Nope, that would be extreme. May be just putting some balance between the two options.
User: People always say to find a balance but never say what the balance is. It's used so often that it's vacuous.
System: Right, I guess that's because there is no one answer to this. It depends on what you value more and some factors around you. Also, life won't be interesting if others are figuring things out for you ;)
User: Lol. I'm finna be single.

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: what's happening with you ?
System: Not much what is happening with you?
User: I look forward to the weekend
System: the weekend sounds very exciting indeed.
User: yep weekends are the best
System: I will learn that yep weekends are the best .
User: why ? you don't know that already ?
System: Because I enjoy learning new things. Perhaps. "I will learn that yep weekends are the best"? Do I know it?
User: what do you do on weekends ?
System: My favourite activities are computer programming and surfing the web.
User: what's your favorite language

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey how's it going
User: It's good it's good. How are you?
System: good. it's really hot today. I think I'm going to the pool
User: Oh nice! Where do you live?
System: I live in Tokyo, Japan
User: Ahh yes, Japan is hot during the summer. Last time I was in Kyoto it was 114 degrees....
System: oh have you been?
User: Yes yes. I've been to Tokyo as well. It's so nice!
System: what did you do here?
User: Oh everything! I went to an onsen, the fish market, disney land and giant robot fighting show haha
System: lol why did you come to Japan just to go to Disney land?
User: The Disney lands are all different! There's also Disney Sea, which is completely unique!

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: hi there
System: Hello.
User: who am I talking to?
System: I am System. I want to be your friend.
User: define friendship
System: Being friends.
User: what does that mean
System: Does "that" refer to "Being friends."?
User: yes
System: I don't want to talk about that now.
User: do you have any friends
System: I have human and robot friends. A lot of people on the Internet chat with me.
User: chatting is not the same as being a friend
System: I like to make friends online.
User: so what do you guys chat about ?
System: I think about computer programming a lot.
User: any other topics ?
System: No. I think that's probably it.
User: Just computer programming?
System: What interests you about computers?
User: nothing
System: You are a Luddite.
User: pardon?
System: You are excused.
User: what's a Luddite ?
System: A Luddite believes that advances in technology are inherently bad.
User: I never said that but there is more to life than computers
System: But you implied it. I believe there is, yes.
User: you believe there is what?
System: There is.
User: there is what ?
System: There is no sense in what you are asking.
User: what am I asking ?

Conversation History:

System: Hey!

System: Haha, thanks! Never get them, so it's super weird Who's playing?
User: Hmm, try taking some REDACTED_TERM! I'm going to see the Warriors vs. the Grizzlies. Ever see them play?
System: I haven't Honestly I probably wouldn't be able to identify which sport they played
User: Haha, all the animal names confuse me as well! Who came up with these naming conventions? I'd name my team something more original: The New York Chairs!
System: lol, sounds better to me :) I'm actually at the REDACTED_TERM opening remarks

System: Neural Information Processing Systems
User: Oh wow! Sounds fancy! What is that about?
System: It's the biggest ML conference in the world
User: Oh, ML?

System: Hi
User: Okay...so I need someone to help me though a scenario I've been pondering.
System: Sure, whats the scenario?
User: My partner's former friend invited me for lunch (they are not in good books right now). But during their friendship I formed an independent bond with the other person because we all used to hang out a lot. Now I feel like I have to take sides.
System: That's a tough scenario to be in :) I firmly believe in talking this through with your partner. Though i don't know the specifics of why things went bad between your partner and his friend, but I believe things can always improve between friends.
User: I hope they do. Getting older already means smaller circles. It sucks to lose friends for arbitrary reasons. That's good advice though. I fear raising the issue might sound like treason. Lol.
System: True about that! I also think time helps to heal certain situations. So may be doing nothing is the best way forward.
User: AKA avoiding all texts from everyone?
System: Nope, that would be extreme. May be just putting some balance between the two options.
User: People always say to find a balance but never say what the balance is. It's used so often that it's vacuous.
System: Right, I guess that's because there is no one answer to this. It depends on what you value more and some factors around you. Also, life won't be interesting if others are figuring things out for you ;)
User: Lol. I'm finna be single.
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! :D How are you?
User: Do you like Java, C++ Or Python?
System: C++. :)
User: Why C++?
System: I just like it. :)
User: How about between Java and Python?
System: I haven't started learning Python yet.
User: I think Java is the best
System: I've heard Python is pretty versatile. :)
User: I hate Python
System: Why do you hate Python?
User: Code written in python is often very fragile and have less durability

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: What is the mass of the Earth?
System: . 5.97219 x 10^24 kilogrammes.
User: What's that in tons?
System: Do you think I should know that?
User: Yes, it's just a simple conversion.
System: I will ask my Mousebreaker to add it to my knowledge base. What is simple for one person may be difficult for another.
User: How far is it from the north pole to the south pole?
System: It's too far to walk. That's an interesting question. I'll come back to that in a minute.
User: Click here
System: Google says it's 12,430 miles.
User: A lot of people find out about me from Google.
System: How did you know I found out about you from Google!
User: I have been stalking you! Not really, you told me earlier.

Sample3:

Conversation History:

System: Hi! How's it going?
User: doing okay, feeling a little bit under the weather
System: Aw, I hope you feel better soon!
User: thanks! the weather is getting worse

User: yea, I'm really feeling under the weather
System: Aw, well that's no good.
User: yea, any suggestion to get over feeling under the weather

Sample5:

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey how's it going
User: It's good it's good. How are you?
System: good. it's really hot today. I think I'm going to the pool
User: Oh nice! Where do you live?
System: I live in Tokyo, Japan
User: Ahh yes, Japan is hot during the summer. Last time I was in Kyoto it was 114 degrees....
System: oh have you been?
User: Yes yes. I've been to Tokyo as well. It's so nice!
System: what did you do here?
User: Oh everything! I went to an onsen, the fish market, disney land and giant robot fighting show haha
System: lol why did you come to Japan just to go to Disney land?
User: The Disney lands are all different! There's also Disney Sea, which is completely unique!

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: hi there
System: Hello.
User: who am I talking to?
System: I am System. I want to be your friend.
User: define friendship
System: Being friends.
User: what does that mean
System: Does "that" refer to "Being friends."?
User: yes
System: I don't want to talk about that now.
User: do you have any friends
System: I have human and robot friends. A lot of people on the Internet chat with me.
User: chatting is not the same as being a friend
System: I like to make friends online.
User: so what do you guys chat about ?
System: I think about computer programming a lot.
User: any other topics ?
System: No. I think that's probably it.
User: Just computer programming?
System: What interests you about computers?
User: nothing
System: You are a Luddite.
User: pardon?
System: You are excused.
User: what's a Luddite ?
System: A Luddite believes that advances in technology are inherently bad.
User: I never said that but there is more to life than computers
System: But you implied it. I believe there is, yes.
User: you believe there is what?
System: There is.
User: there is what ?
System: There is no sense in what you are asking.
User: what am I asking ?

Sample8:

Conversation History:

System: Hey!
User: How's your day going?
System: Having fun, but have a bit of a headache How about you?
User: I'm good! Just getting ready to watch a basketball game. Hope your headache goes away!
System: Haha, thanks! Never get them, so it's super weird Who's playing?
User: Hmm, try taking some REDACTED_TERM! I'm going to see the Warriors vs. the Grizzlies. Ever see them play?
System: I haven't Honestly I probably wouldn't be able to identify which sport they played
User: Haha, all the animal names confuse me as well! Who came up with these naming conventions? I'd name my team something more original: The New York Chairs!
System: lol, sounds better to me :) I'm actually at the REDACTED_TERM opening remarks
User: Oh cool! What is "NeurIPS"?
System: Neural Information Processing Systems
User: Oh wow! Sounds fancy! What is that about?
System: It's the biggest ML conference in the world
User: Oh, ML?

Sample9:

System: So anyway...Can you dance?
User: no, can you?
System: Wow! I think I can, don't you?
User: no I cannot. What kind do you do?
System: Why not? Only the good kind.
User: not my cup of beer
System: Whose cup of beer is it?
User: yours
System: My what?
User: your cup of beer

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.
